Articles.Content: If I had to narrow it down to just one thing, it would be hunting down all the easter eggs- both on the various planets etc. and also in part descriptions, background scenery in the VAB, all the little puns that make things that little bit more interesting.

I'm looking forward to playing with the colonies, specifically building rockets off-world.  If I can launch from a planet without an atmosphere (or construct ships in orbit) I can make creatively (read: stupidly)-shaped rockets without worrying about aerodynamics.
I'm looking forward to some quality of life improvements like the faster load times and part coloring.

I am excited for a possibility of built in modding support, and the chance to add to an amazing game.

Also, the fun of working through the game from constant fresh starts, as new feature get added constantly from the devs.  

Edited February 22, 2023 by theJesuit
I'm really impressed by all the effort put into the sound design in KSP2! Really looking to hearing the roars of my rockets as I take off!
I am excited to get into thick of bug hunting and interaction with the developers and fellow KSP enthusiasts to get KSP2 to a level that we are all proud of.
All of it, just everything.
Sounds!

I'm excited just the game in general

Edited February 22, 2023 by whiteturtle0923
typo
Moar parts!

I'm excited about the new rover parts. Rovers felt awkward in ksp 1. With the new parts, building functional rovers will be much easier.  now we won't have to relocate our colony because they are in a low ore area
I am excited for interplanetary exploration, new rocket technologies, and the better graphics.
I'm excited for the new maneuver planner making it easier to do extremely long maneuvers.
I'm excited about revisiting all my old haunts on moons and planets. And finally doing something I never did in KSP - building a permanent base on Eeloo.
Hi, i like ksp and would love to have a ksp 2 key. i have a deep interest in space and would like to work for nasa
im excited for the new parts and the new interface!
I’m excited for the excellent looking surfaces of the planets, new effects like dust rising upon landing, and everything else that will create an immersive experience!
I´m very excited to see the orbital assembly building and the interestellar travels, I am from Brazil, sorry for the bad english.
I'm excited about to see how this game will develop over the coming years.
I am excited about the new sound design! It was very promising on the gameplay I saw on youtube on the previous days and also the video about it made on the official youtube channel was very nice.
I am excited for the detailed planet surfaces, and the ability to do brachistochrone trajectories
I'm very excited to help make this game best it can be through Early Access and see it grow and mature into something more than KSP1 ever was.

I'm excited about the development process. I always loved games where the developers take our input into account to further the game. Like Factorio and Minecraft.

For me, new version releases bring about the same feeling as unwrapping gifts when we were young.

Edited February 22, 2023 by FieryBull
I'm excited about the images I saw of Minmus' icy surface. It immediately made me think I want to build a sled and slide down the Minmus slopes. Needless to say it will be a rocket powered sled.
Where to start?  Background burns, the refined GUI and visuals, the new VAB!
